markdown: Just yum for every occasion. Because this torta is so festive looking, we would often have it as an appetizer during the holidays.
It has always been a family favorite.

ingredients.name: pine nuts roasted in a dry skillet over medium heat
sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil and drained

markdown: 1. I usually layer this into two 2-cup saran lined plastic lidded containers, but it can be made as one large torta. Sprinkle the bottom of the containers with a 1/6 of the pine nuts, 1/6 of the sundried tomatoes, 1/6 of the pesto, and 1/6 of the cheese mixture.
2. Repeat two more times and end with more pine nuts.
3. Close the saran over the layered mixture and snap the lids on. Chill at lease one hour, or up to a week.
4. To unmold, unwrap the saran and turn the mold upside down on a serving platter.
5. Carefully remove the saran and serve with multigrain crackers or melba toasts. Drain and set aside to cool.
